-style omurice (omelette with fried rice), mixed greens salad
Snack: Fresh fruit and cottage cheese

Day 13:
Breakfast: Kodian-style smoothie bowl with berries, nuts, and seeds
Lunch: Yamataian sushi handrolls, edamame, cucumber salad
Dinner: Scandinavian-style baked haddock, steamed vegetables, quinoa
Snack: Apple slices with peanut butter

Day 14:
Breakfast: Yamataian rice porridge with pickled plum, grilled fish
Lunch: Kodian-style grilled chicken salad with avocado and nuts
Dinner: Yoshoku-style spaghetti with meat sauce, garlic bread, mixed greens salad
Snack: Veggie sticks with guacamole

This 2-week meal plan incorporates both Kodian and Yamataian food, focusing on health and sustainability. The plan includes a variety of proteins, whole grains, fruits, and vegetables to ensure a balanced diet while also introducing the flavors and traditions of both cultures.
